intro: Drymonia fimbriata, commonly known as the fringed drymonia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to red. It typically grows in wetland habitats such as swamps and marshes. The leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a velvety texture.
